member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsResult.Content
member.summary: Supplies a snippet of content from the news story associated with this search result.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsResult.Image
member.summary: This property is optional. It only appears in a result when the system has determined that there is a good image that represents the cluster of news articles related to this result.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsSearchRequest.SortBy
member.summary: This optional argument tells the news search system how to order results. Results may be ordered by relevance (which is the default), or by date. To select ordering by relevance, do not supply this argument. To select ordering by date, set scoring as scoring=d.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsSearchRequest.Geo
member.summary: This optional argument tells the news search system to scope search results to a particular location. With this argument present, the query argument (q) becomes optional. Note, this is a very new feature and locally scoped query coverage is somewhat sparse. You must supply either a city, state, country, or zip code as in geo=Santa%20Barbara or geo=British%20Columbia or geo=Peru or geo=93108.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsSearchRequest.QuoteId
member.summary: This optional argument tells the news search system to scope search results to include only quote typed results (rather than classic news article style results). With this argument present, the query argument (q) becomes optional. The value of this argument designates a prominent individual whose quotes have been recognized and classified by the Google News search service. For instance, Barack Obama has a qsid value of tPjE5CDNzMicmM and John McCain has a value of lE61RnznhxvadM. Note, this is a very new feature and we currently do not have a good search or descovery mechanism for these qsid values..

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsSearchRequest.Topic
member.summary: This optional argument tells the news search system to scope search results to a particular topic. The value of the argument specifies the topic in the current or selected edition.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GnewsSearchRequest.Edition
member.summary: This optional argument tells the news search system which edition of news to pull results from.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GpatentSearchRequest.IssuedOnly

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GpatentSearchRequest.FiledOnly
member.summary: This optional argument tells the patent search system to restrict the search to ONLY patents that only been filed, skipping over all patents that have been issued. When specified, that value must be 1 as in &as_psra=1.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GpatentSearchRequest.SortBy
member.summary: This optional argument tells the patent search system how to order results. Results may be ordered by relevance (which is the default), or by date. To select ordering by relevance, do not supply this argument. To select ordering by descending date where the newest result is first, set scoring as scoring=d. To select ordering by ascending date where the oldest result is first, set scoring as scoring=ad.

To play this video simply create and <embed> element on your page using this value as the src attribute and using application/x-shockwave-flash as the type attribute. If you want the video to play right away, make sure to append &autoPlay=is true to the url.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GvideoSearchRequest.SortBy
member.summary: This optional argument tells the video search system how to order results. Results may be ordered by relevance (which is the default), or by date. To select ordering by relevance, do not supply this argument. To select ordering by date, set scoring as scoring=d.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.IWebResult.CacheUrl
member.summary: Gets a url to google's cached version of the page responsible for producting this result. This property may be null indicating that there is no cache, and it might be out of date in cases where the search result has been saved and in the mean time, the cache has gone stale. For best results, this property should not be persisted.

member.name: P:Google.API.Search.GwebSearchRequest.Country
member.summary: This optional argument allows the caller to tailor the results to a specific country. The value should be a valid country code (e.g. uk, de, etc.). If this argument is not present, then the system will use a value based on the domain used to load the API (e.g. http://www.google.com/jsapi). If the API loader was not used, a value of "us" is assumed.
